alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:21PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Missoula and southern Lake Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 620 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wye, or 7 miles northwest of Missoula, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Wye, Arlee, Evaro and Frenchtown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 90 and 100. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
